current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To streamline the oil and gas permitting process and to recognize fee ownership for certain oil and
			 gas drilling or spacing units, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: drilling permit shall not be required under the

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law but subject to any State requirements, a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or section
			 3164.1 of title 43, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor
			 regulation), for an action occurring within
			 an oil and gas drilling or spacing unit if—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Federal Oil and
			 Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982

text.#text:
less than 50 percent of  the minerals within the oil and gas drilling or spacing unit are minerals
			 owned by the Federal Government; and

the Federal Government does not own or lease the surface estate within the boundaries of the oil
			 and gas drilling or spacing unit.

Nothing in this Act affects the right of the Federal Government to receive royalties due to the
			 Federal Government from the production of the Federal minerals within the
			 oil and gas drilling  or spacing unit.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2894 IS: To streamline the oil and gas permitting process and to recognize fee ownership for certain oil and gas drilling or spacing units, and for other purposes.
